page.title: 10 TRANSPORT
page.content: THE MAJOR ROADS FOCUS ON GRAVESEND.MAIN ROADS LINK THE AREA TO THE MEDWAY TOWNS AND WROTHAM.THE A2 JUST TOUCHES THE SOUTH-WEST CORNER.HOUSING ESTATES HAVE FORMED BETWEEN THE RADIATING ROADS, AND BUS SERVICES HAVE BEEN ESTABLISHED TO LINK THESE ESTATES WITH TOWN CENTRES.LONDON COUNTRY OPERATE MOST OF THE LOCAL SERVICES,SOME OF WHICH CONTINUE TO DARTFORD AND ERITH. WHILE MAIDSTONE AND DISTRICT ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE LONGER SERVICES TO THE SOUTH AND EAST.COACH SERVICES PROVIDE COMMUTER AND SHOPPING LINKS WITH LONDON.THE NORTH KENT LINE OF THE SOUTHERN REGION PASSES THROUGH THE AREA PROVIDING A FREQUENT ELECTRIC SERVICE BETWEEN CHARING CROSS,THE MEDWAY TOWNS AND THE KENT COAST.THE MINOR ROADS BECOME SMALLER AS THEY REACH THE TOWN.THERE ARE PARKING RESTRICTIONS,BUT MULTI-STORY CARPARKS HAVE BEEN BUILT.
